article.title: A Faint Flux-Limited Lyman Alpha Emitter Sample at $z∼0.3$

multiple_choice_question.text: The figure shows examples of LAE UV spectra with assigned confidence classes. What do the superscripts next to the listed Lyα redshifts indicate?
choices: The number of exposures used to construct the data cube.
The signal-to-noise ratio of the detected Lyα emission line.
The confidence level that the identified candidate is real and not an artifact.
The number of independent slices used for background subtraction.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the black histogram in Figure 2 represent?
choices: The redshift distribution of the confirmed LAE galaxies.
The Lyα flux distribution of the LAE candidates.
The completeness of the LAE catalog as a function of redshift.
The distribution of spectral noise in the data cubes.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the purpose of the BPT diagnostic diagram shown in Figure 3?
choices: To determine the redshift of the LAE galaxies.
To measure the Lyα luminosity of the LAE galaxies.
To separate star-forming galaxies from AGNs based on emission line ratios.
To determine the equivalent width of the Lyα emission line.

multiple_choice_question.text: Figure 4 shows the AGN fraction per Lyα luminosity bin for two LAE samples. What trend is observed?
choices: The AGN fraction remains constant with increasing Lyα luminosity.
The AGN fraction decreases with increasing Lyα luminosity.
The AGN fraction increases with increasing Lyα luminosity.
There is no clear trend between the AGN fraction and Lyα luminosity.

multiple_choice_question.text: The formula shown represents the Schechter function. What does the parameter α represent?
choices: The characteristic luminosity of the LAE galaxies.
The normalization of the LAE luminosity function.
The faint-end slope of the LAE luminosity function.
The redshift of the LAE galaxies.

multiple_choice_question.text: Formula 7 defines the volumetric Lyα escape fraction (f\nLyα\nesc). What does this quantity represent?
choices: The fraction of Lyα photons absorbed by dust in the LAE galaxy.
The fraction of Lyα photons scattered by neutral hydrogen in the LAE galaxy.
The fraction of Lyα photons that escape from the survey volume.
The fraction of Lyα photons produced by AGN activity in the LAE galaxy.
